description: Manage subnets in an Azure Virtual Network.

commands.name: az network vnet subnet create
commands.summary: Create a subnet and associate an existing NSG and route table.
commands.syntax:
az network vnet subnet create --name
                              --resource-group
                              --vnet-name
                              [--address-prefixes]
                              [--default-outbound {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--delegations]
                              [--disable-private-endpoint-network-policies {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--disable-private-link-service-network-policies {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--endpoints]
                              [--nat-gateway]
                              [--network-security-group]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--ple-network-policies {Disabled, Enabled, NetworkSecurityGroupEnabled, RouteTableEnabled}]
                              [--pls-network-policies {Disabled, Enabled}]
                              [--route-table]
                              [--service-endpoint-policy]
                              [--service-endpoints]
                              [--sharing-scope {DelegatedServices, Tenant}]
examples: az network vnet subnet create -g MyResourceGroup --vnet-name MyVnet -n MySubnet --address-prefixes 10.0.0.0/24 --network-security-group MyNsg --route-table MyRouteTable
az network vnet subnet create -n MySubnet --vnet-name MyVnet -g MyResourceGroup --nat-gateway MyNatGateway --address-prefixes "10.0.0.0/21"

commands.name: az network vnet subnet delete
commands.syntax:
az network vnet subnet delete [--ids]
                              [--name]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--vnet-name]
examples: az network vnet subnet delete --name MySubnet --resource-group MyResourceGroup --vnet-name MyVnet

commands.name: az network vnet subnet list
commands.summary: List the subnets in a virtual network.
examples: az network vnet subnet list -g MyResourceGroup --vnet-name MyVNet

commands.name: az network vnet subnet list-available-delegations
commands.summary: List the services available for subnet delegation.
examples: az network vnet subnet list-available-delegations -l westus --query [].serviceName
az network vnet subnet list-available-delegations --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network vnet subnet list-available-ips
commands.summary: List some available ips in the subnet.
examples: az network vnet subnet list-available-ips --resource-group MyResourceGroup --vnet-name MyVNet -n MySubnet

commands.name: az network vnet subnet show
examples: az network vnet subnet show -g MyResourceGroup -n MySubnet --vnet-name MyVNet

commands.name: az network vnet subnet update
commands.syntax:
az network vnet subnet update [--add]
                              [--address-prefixes]
                              [--default-outbound {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--delegations]
                              [--disable-private-endpoint-network-policies {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--disable-private-link-service-network-policies {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--endpoints]
                              [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--ids]
                              [--name]
                              [--nat-gateway]
                              [--network-security-group]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--ple-network-policies {Disabled, Enabled, NetworkSecurityGroupEnabled, RouteTableEnabled}]
                              [--pls-network-policies {Disabled, Enabled}]
                              [--remove]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--route-table]
                              [--service-endpoint-policy]
                              [--service-endpoints]
                              [--set]
                              [--sharing-scope {DelegatedServices, Tenant}]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--vnet-name]
examples: az network vnet subnet update -g MyResourceGroup -n MySubnet --vnet-name MyVNet --network-security-group MyNsg
az network vnet subnet update -n MySubnet --vnet-name MyVnet -g MyResourceGroup --nat-gateway MyNatGateway --address-prefixes "10.0.0.0/21"
az network vnet subnet update -n MySubnet --vnet-name MyVnet -g MyResourceGroup --private-endpoint-network-policies Disabled
az network vnet subnet update -g MyResourceGroup --vnet-name MyVNet -n MySubnet --nsg null

commands.name: az network vnet subnet wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
